In July last year , Punjab allocated solar power projects to 26 developers for 250 MW after a competitive bidding process .
Further , these 26 developers signed power purchase agreement with the state power utility .
According to sources , only 50 per cent of the developers could arrange land either by acquisition or by entering into pacts with farmers for leasing .
Sources in the state government told Business Standard the state 's rural department has issued a notification so that the vacant panchayat land can be given to these players on lease hold basis .

Among the major companies who are setting up solar power projects are Lanco Solar Energy , Punj Lloyd Infrastructure , Moser Baer Clean Energy , Essel Infra Projects , Asopus Infrastructure ( India Bulls ) , Welspun Solar Punjab , Azure Urja , among others .
These players are likely to invest around Rs 2,200-2 , 500 crore in the state and will take another 13-15 months for completion of project .
With the commissioning of these units , the state will add another 250 MW .
